title: Quality Assurance Representative
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Quality Assurance Representative will be responsible for all onsite inspections and evaluations of the Bureau of Indian Education facilities at Haskell Indian Nations University and Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute.

This is contingent on the award of the contract. 

Salary: $75,000.00 to $120,000.00 PER YEAR + BENEFITS (Medical insurance/ 401K plan/ HSA plan/ Holiday pay/ PTO/ Maternity leave).

Key responsibilities:

  • Perform daily onsite inspection of the progress and quality of work
  • Inform the client on any work discrepancy from the construction contract
  • Monitor construction schedules and report any possible delay
  • Receive and respond to requests for information and changes from contractors
  • Observe tests and report results
  • Update project logbook of all daily activities
  • Assist in reviewing drawings and additional design drawings
  • Review and maintain payroll records
  • Perform final inspection
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed 

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s degree graduate of Engineering Technology or Construction Management with at least 10 years of construction inspection experience or 15 years of construction experience with performing similar task
  • Certification from the National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies or other recognized organization is desirable
  • Licensed journeyman electrician or plumber
  • Handled multi-disciplined projects greater than $1million
  • Construction Quality Verification or equivalent training
  • Completed OSHA 30 training within the past 2 years
  • Knowledgeable on safety practices, with background in USACE EM 385-1-1 and OSHA safety requirements
  • Physically able to walk over rough, uneven, slippery surfaces, lift heavy loads and climb ladders
  • Highly knowledgeable in engineering principles, concepts and practices
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
  • With a valid driver’s license
  • Competent computer skills

 Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

Why Planate?

Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally, and Professionally, Up and Down The Line.  

We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

title: Construction Administrator
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, the USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Construction Administrator will be responsible for coordination and administration of all projects of the Bureau of Indian Education projects at Haskell Indian Nations University and Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute.

This is contingent on the award of the contract.

Salary: $50,000.00 to $90,000.00 PER YEAR + BENEFITS (Medical insurance/ 401K plan/ HSA plan/ Holiday pay/ PTO/ Maternity leave)

The company will shoulder a reasonable relocation allowance. 

Key responsibilities:

  • Work with various functional groups such as IT, mechanical, plumbing and electrical personnel for proper work coordination
  • Conduct pre-construction conference and serve as a technical resource to the client
  • Provide meeting agenda and minutes, and cost data for all real property construction
  • Act as the liaison between the contractor and the client with regard to Requests for Information (RFI), drawings, data and submittals
  • Recommend corrective actions, when needed
  • Review of pay applications and documents and suggest recommendations
  • Report weekly updates during weekly meetings
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from an accredited college or university
  • At least 5 years of construction engineering or construction management experience
  • Experienced in developing and maintaining complex construction management activities including submittal and processing of Request for Information
  • Knowledgeable in construction scheduling methods and familiar with the use of Primavera P3/P6, RS Means/CostWorks and Microsoft Projects
  • Experienced in Federal building design criteria and construction guide specifications
  • Completed OSHA 30 training within the past 2 years
  • Physically able to walk over rough, uneven, slippery surfaces, lift heavy loads and climb ladders
  • Highly knowledgeable in engineering principles, concepts and practices
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
  • With a valid driver’s license

 Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

title: Quality Assurance Representative
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, the USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Quality Assurance Representative is responsible for developing and maintaining an effective QC program to ensure services are performed in accordance with the contract at the Southwestern Indian Polytechnic Institute, Albuquerque, NM.  

This is contingent upon the award of the contract.

Salary: $75,000.00 to $120,000.00 PER YEAR + BENEFITS (Medical insurance/ 401K plan/ HSA plan/ Holiday pay/ PTO/ Maternity leave)

The company will shoulder a reasonable relocation allowance. 

 Key responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement procedures to identify, prevent and ensure the non-recurrence of defective services
  • Provide the inspection description of the system and methods to be used
  • Report all instances of non-compliance with safety requirements
  • Monitor compliance with environmental protection requirements
  • Monitor and measure survey activities and material testing
  • Review and monitor the contractor quality and production reports and submittal logs
  • Schedule pre-final and final inspections
  • Record and safekeep the documents of all inspections and corrective actions taken
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Degree in Quality Control Management, Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Knowledge of the construction process, means and methods, and materials, their characteristics, installation procedures, and tolerances
  • Previous experience with construction, renovation, and maintenance & repair of existing federal facilities
  • Demonstrated ability to think creatively and logically to resolve various issues in the development process
  • Strong background in construction scheduling methods and building and construction crafts since detailed construction Engineering knowledge shall be needed to verify that specific workmanship is obtained
  • Completed OSHA 30 training within the past 2 years
  • US citizenship is required

title: Commissioning Agent
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, the USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Commissioning Agent will be responsible for all review activities and commissioning requirements of the Bureau of Indian Education facilities at Haskell Indian Nations University and Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute.

This is contingent on the award of the contract.

Salary: $80,000.00 to $120,000.00 PER YEAR + BENEFITS (Medical insurance/ 401K plan/ HSA plan/ Holiday pay/ PTO/ Maternity leave)

The company will shoulder a reasonable relocation allowance. 

Key responsibilities:

  • A thorough review of the program drawings and specifications and consulting with the design team to develop commissioning requirements
  • Provide a commissioning plan with a detailed schedule of activities
  • Update the plan and schedule as the project progresses and include necessary details as needed
  • Discuss requirements in order to arrange a preparatory inspection
  • Weekly site visits and review pending activities
  • Provide training for building systems to be commissioned prior to acceptance
  • Develop a systems manual for all systems installed and provide a test-specific schedule for all functional and system performance tests
  • Prepare and submit a post-commissioning report
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Minimum of 6 years experience as a principal commissioning authority on at least 3 projects within the last 3 years
  • Knowledge of design-build methodologies and quality control processes
  • Completed OSHA 30 training within the past 2 years
  • Experienced in the operation and troubleshooting of HVAC systems, energy management and controls systems, lighting controls systems, building electrical systems, fire alarm systems, data systems and security systems
  • Knowledge in testing and balancing hydronic/air systems
  • Experienced in monitoring and analyzing system operation and equipment startup requirements
  • Knowledgeable in building/equipment operation and maintenance
  • Design experience incorporating energy usage, heating/cooling load calculations and specifying energy-efficient equipment
  • Knowledge of ASHRAE Guideline-0 requirements and U.S. Green Building Council LEED Green Building Rating Systems and Guiding Principles for Sustainable Federal Buildings
  • With a valid driver’s license

 Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

title: Construction Manager
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, the USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Construction Manager will be responsible for all work performed on the Bureau of Indian Education projects at Haskell Indian Nations University and Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute. Main responsibilities would include control of schedule and budget, resolving problems and conflicts, and ensuring that work is confirmed with applicable codes.

This is contingent on the award of the contract.

Salary: $90,000.00 to $140,000.00 PER YEAR + BENEFITS (Medical insurance/ 401K plan/ HSA plan/ Holiday pay/ PTO/ Maternity leave)

The company will shoulder a reasonable relocation allowance. 

Key responsibilities:

  • Oversight of planning, studies, site investigations, and surveys
  • Prepare budget, cost estimates, and schedules
  • Provide oversight of design management, technical, constructability, and code compliance reviews
  • Assist in contract procurement and prepare answers to bid questions
  • Set up a temporary office, organize records, schedule meetings, and monitor activities
  • Responsible for special inspection services such as monitoring the removal of hazardous materials, and reviewing the historical significance in buildings
  • Provide tenant relocation and moving services
  • Provide onsite technical assistance on repair estimates and timetables
  • Develop plans and conceptual design solutions
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed

Qualifications To be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering from an accredited college or university
  • Professional licensure is preferred
  • At least 10 years of construction engineering or construction management experience
  • Completed OSHA 30 training within the past 2 years
  • Experienced in managing multiple tasks and projects
  • Able to plan and manage staff, budget, schedules, and clients for large projects
  • Experienced in organizing, directing, and coordinating strategic planning activities
  • Experienced in Federal building design criteria and construction guide specifications
  • Knowledgeable in construction scheduling methods and familiar with the use of Primavera P3/P6, RS Means/CostWorks, and Microsoft Projects
  • Physically able to walk over rough, uneven, slippery surfaces, lift heavy loads and climb ladders
  • With a valid driver’s license
  • Excellent English is written and verbal communication skills

title: Recruitment Officer (Fully remote)
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The Recruitment Officer is mainly responsible for the day to day management of Recruitment under Human Resources Group. 

This is remote work with an hourly-based wage position. 

Hourly rate: Php 250 to Php 350 

Key responsibilities:                    

  • Implement the overall recruiting strategy of Planate that includes
  • Perform job and task analysis to document job requirements and objectives
  • Prepare and post jobs to appropriate job board/newspapers/colleges, etc.
  • Source and attract candidates by using databases, social media, etc.
  • Screen candidate's resumes and job applications
  • Conduct interviews using various reliable personnel selection tools/methods to filter candidates within schedule
  • Assess applicants’ relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience, and aptitudes
  • Schedule/endorsement with the hiring manager
  • Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process
  • Build a good working relationship with the leads to optimize strategy for workforce planning
  • Develop job descriptions and job-specific actions based on the scope of work given by the hiring manager
  • Act as the project lead on the efficient use of Recruiter Box or other recruitment tasks to be assigned by the superior.
  • Keep candidates record and stages updated
  • Provide analytical and well documented recruitment reports as needed by the team
  • Support the onboarding of the new staff in order to become fully integrated with the Organization
  • Ensure compliance with the government reports/documentations /requirements and submit based on timeline
  • Promote company’s reputation as “best place to work”
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 

Qualifications To be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology or a related discipline
  • With at least 5 to 10 years experience in recruitment
  • Must have experience in client management
  • Must have solid experience in sourcing active and passive candidates via job portals, social media, etc.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suites

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

title: ELECTRICAL /COMPUTER/NETWORK ENGINEER
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The Engineer will be responsible for performing the evaluation and analysis of the current Employee Health Record Modernization project status. You will serve as a representative of the client to assist in monitoring the complete campus-wide backbone infrastructure upgrade, provide cost analyses, monitor project status, and help to coordinate tasks being done by the construction contractor and designer of record.

This work will potentially be in multiple positions with one or more engineers onsite at the Department of Veteran’s Affairs Hospitals in Beckley, Clarksburg, Huntington, and Martinsburg, in West Virginia, Washington, DC and Baltimore, Perry Point, and Loch Raven in Maryland. The contract has not yet been awarded to Planate.

Salary: $ 80,000.00 to $130,000.00 PER YEAR

Key responsibilities:

  • Assist the VA in monitoring project quality, schedule, and budget. 
  • Review work being performed by the construction contractor and designer of record
  • Make recommendations on potential improvements and efficiencies
  • Monitor daily progress in the field to ensure the project is progressing per specifications and following applicable codes
  • Work as a team member with other technical staff, such as systems to ensure connectivity and compatibility between systems
  • Work with vendors to resolve complex network problems
  • Maintain confidentiality regarding the information being processed, stored, or accessed by the network
  • Document network problems and resolutions for future reference
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.

Qualifications To be successful in the role:

  • Degree in Electrical Engineering or Information Technology or in any field of computer science/technology
  • At least 5 years of experience
  • Background in handling or installing fiber optic cables, computer networks, or electrical system upgrades required to support such equipment.
  • Previously working in a healthcare environment was desirable

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally, and Professionally, Up and Down The Line.

title: Mechanical Engineer (Secret or Top Secret Security Clearance Required)
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

Planate Management Group is ACTIVELY recruiting a Mechanical Engineer supporting the US Consulate in Morocco with a probable project duration of 24 months. 

Description of the Project:

The Casablanca New Consulate Compound (NCC) project site is located in the Casa-Anfa neighborhood, in a rapidly developing section of the city at the former airport location. The site is a seven acre compound and includes a four-story NOB, MSGR, three CACs, two single level underground parking garages, utility and SPX buildings with a Regional Delivery Courier Facility, and a Recreation facility with pool. The project is a D/B contact with BLHI and KCCT as Architect of Record.

Job Details:

  • The project duration is 24 months
  • The position is full-time at 50 hours per week.  Overtime shall not exceed 10 hours per week and must be approved by the Project Director
  • Following contract award, staff must deploy within 30 days to be onsite
  • Personnel must be able to maintain a Top Secret Clearance

General Job Requirements:

  • US Citizen. Must possess a Final Secret, Interim Top Secret (ITS), or Final Top Secret (TS) clearance issued by Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA) at the time of deployment to overseas OBO construction sites for performance on this contract, employees shall possess at minimum Final Secret clearance. However, all employees must be able to obtain a Top Secret clearance.
  • Candidates proposed for Project Controls positions shall possess a degree in Engineering (any discipline), Engineering Management, Construction Management, or Construction Engineering if hired under the engineering labor category and must have seven (7) years of experience in the commercial construction industry. Further candidates possessing a 4 year degree may be considered if they demonstrate seven years of relevant PCE experience.

  • Professional Engineering registration is preferred.

  • Knowledge of International Codes is required.

  • Develops working knowledge of all technical requirements of the project.

  • Provides Quality Assurance for the ongoing construction project.

  • Reviews contractor submittals.

  • Experience in assessing and responding to Requests for Information (RFI).

  • Evaluates proposed submittal substitutions with engineering implications; makes recommendations to the Project Director.

  • Coordinates the development of Independent Government Estimates (IGEs) for modifications and change orders.

  • Experience in reviewing and evaluating design calculations and data from an engineering perspective.

  • Prepares Monthly Progress Reports and attends meetings summarizing project status, with emphasis on engineering.

  • Knowledge of Construction Safety regulations, e. EM 385-1-1, OSHA, etc.

  • Knowledge of Microsoft Suite, e., PowerPoint, Excel, and Word required.

  • Other related duties as assigned by the Project Director.

Specific Duties:

General - The position functions as the Mechanical Engineer, providing OBO/Casablanca a full range of critical engineering and construction quality assurance and management and technical oversight of the Casablanca NCC Project. A Mechanical Engineering degree is required. The incumbent is responsible for performing technical inspections of mechanical work, monitoring the contractor's quality control program, and reviewing project drawings and specifications to ensure compliance. This position is established to support and assist OBO/Casablanca in ensuring the completion of the project in accordance with contract requirements. Specific experience with Building Automation Systems, monitor controls and disconnects, general plumbing, water/sewage treatment, power generation and HVAC systems.

 

Why Planate?

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We take care of our own; personally, and professionally, up and down the line.

Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Finance and Accounting Manager
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, the USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Finance and Accounting Manager will be responsible for the oversight, direction, and management of the Accounting Department and the Financial Planning and Analysis unit. He or she is accountable for all accounting operations, including the production of regular, standardized financial reports produced, where appropriate, in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles and any specific requirements that apply to U.S. government contractors, maintenance of accounting software, development of a comprehensive set of internal controls, and general oversight of budgets and forecasts designed to mitigate risk and contribute to the formulation of strategies designed to accomplish the company’s general goals and objectives.

Salary per month: Php 120k with other benefits

Key responsibilities:

  • Oversee the accounting/finance staff and operations of the accounting department including the design of an organizational structure and determination of staffing levels adequate for achieving the department's goals and objectives
  • Oversee monthly accounting process including the preparation and distribution of regular, standardized financial reports
  • Ensure that accounting department staff receive all necessary training
  • Provide guidance on financial standards and internal controls as well as evaluating financial systems and processes
  • Oversee outsourced financial functions (Payroll and 401K)
  • Collaborate with FP&A in developing and issuing financial and operating metrics; analyzing variances from the budget; preparing ad hoc financial reports; conducting cash flow planning and analysis; providing financial analyses as needed, particularly for capital investments, contract pricing decisions and contract negotiations
  • Manage interdepartmental relationships and coordination
  • Collaborate with Internal Audit to ensure compliance with the company’s procedures and standards
  • Responsible for the complete and accurate client and project-based accounting and financial reporting
  • Ensure the Accounting team completes all necessary monthly/quarterly/annual reconciliations
  • Ensure compliance with US federal and state regulations
  • Serve as primary contact for external auditors
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration
  • CPA Preferred
  • 10+ years of progressive accounting and finance experience; 3-5 Years of management experience
  • With work experience in the BPO/KPO industry, preferred
  • US government contracting experience is highly preferred
  • Experience with DCAA compliant ERP systems and QuickBooks experience preferred
  • Ability to establish and work under, and meet tight deadlines and deliverables
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and to effectively manage time and priorities
  • Must have experience with payroll service providers, insurance brokers, and 401k administrators
  • Experience with collaboration with other departments
  • Experience in financial analysis preferred
  • Fundamental knowledge of GAAP
  • Some US income and payroll tax understanding preferred
  • Ability to quickly adapt as situations change and make the best possible decisions with the information at hand
  • Strong leadership qualities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable working remotely

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The  Electrical Engineer will be supporting the PMG GTSC Group in providing design plans and assisting activities that consist of all aspects of electrical engineering works. He/ She may also be involved in Subic Bay Shipyard Project located in Cawag Subic Zambales.

Key responsibilities:

  • Performs design work for new construction, renovations, and improvement projects for real property facilities
  • Interprets and adapts traditional methods and approaches in developing design calculations, layouts, drawings, and specifications that support project objectives and standards
  • Responsible for selected construction inspections, quality control, and submittal reviews beyond the expertise of construction managers
  • Develops cost estimates and time schedules, Reviews and analyzes preliminary and final designs, plans, and specifications for technical efficiency and adequacy
  • Prepares necessary correspondence, technical reports, contract documents, fact sheets, and status reports and prepares final construction drawings suitable for obtaining qualified bids from Contractors
  • Perform detailed calculations to establish standards and specifications
  • Inspect installations and observe operations to ensure compliance with design and equipment specifications and safety standards
  • Use computer-assisted engineering software (AutoCAD, coordination studies a load analysis) to perform engineering tasks as assigned.
  • Support the Contract management, and Planning divisions with scope, programming, and scheduling definition
  • Provide quality assurance for ongoing projects, and serve as a mentor to less experienced engineers in the division
  • Can adapt to current and latest technical innovations in electrical engineering
  • Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.

Qualifications To be successful in the role:

  • Degree in Electrical Engineering
  • Licensed Electrical Engineer
  • At least one  year of work experience 
  • Willing to learn and adapt to various situations; multi-tasker.
  • Adequate relevant training
  • Proficient in AutoCAD and other Microsoft Office Applications
  • Excellent oral and written communication and skills
  • Possess excellent problem-solving skills and a creative approach to new technologies
  • Possess a Philippine Passport and a Driver’s License.

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Why Planate?

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally and Professionally, Up and Down The Line. 

We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), which provides installation/base management and facilities engineering worldwide. The primary capability areas of Planate are on Architectural Engineering Design & Planning, Program & Construction Management and Technical & Consulting Services.

 

 

 

The Administrative Assistant position requires demonstrated flexibility, tact, and diplomacy. The position must have the ability to communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization. The position must also possess the ability to anticipate the needs of the operations and business operations and respond accordingly while working in an environment with competing priorities and deadlines.

This position is a full-time/1099 office-based job located in Orlando FL.

Key responsibilities:

  • Coordinate office activities and operations to secure efficiency and compliance with company policies
  • Manage phone calls and correspondence (e-mail, letters, packages etc.)
  • Provide general support to visitors, clients, employees
  • Assist in procurement
  • Handle asset management and inventory mail and ship items
  • Schedule and arrange appointments, meetings, and reservations as needed
  • Maintain and order supplies for Planate offices
  • Coordinate staff and visiting staff travel arrangements including transportation and accommodations
  • Execute printing requests and other documents
  • Manage the cleaning service, utilities, rentals, and other requirements
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate

Qualification to be successful in the role:

  • A high school diploma or general education degree (GED) is required. Associate's degree in Business Administration preferred
  • New graduates are welcome
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Comfortable and flexible with routinely shifting demands and responsibilities
  • A high degree of attention to detail
  • Data entry experience
  • Working knowledge of general office equipment

 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin.

title: Planner and Estimator
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The Planner and Estimator is responsible for planning and developing requirements, estimating and evaluating costs associated with facility requirements for either repairs or maintenance and base operating support contract in Camp Lemonnier, Djibouti.

This is a one-month contract.

Key responsibilities:

  • Review and recommend approval/disapproval of minor project Quality Control Plans and minor project safety/accident prevention plans
  • Review customer work requests and recommend the appropriate methods of accomplishment
  • Interact with Clients, contractors and Navy Contracting Office to identify facility issues and develop recommended solutions
  • Make visits to worksites to obtain information on facility/site conditions to develop and recommend appropriate remedial actions
  • Support the scheduling of required outages to avoid work stoppages for contactors, Clients and Navy Contracting Office operations
  • Review and monitor work completion and provide recommendations for actions aiding customer and Public Works acceptance of completed work
  • Analyze work schedule by contractor or in-house forces for appropriate logic and compliance with contract terms and provide recommendations to Navy Contracting Office Administrative Contracting Officers
  • Conduct problem resolution for the Navy Contracting Office Department and handling of disputed issues including recommendations for the establishment of Government position
  • Develop draft project cost estimates for minor work, repair, and maintenance. Provide price evaluation for material purchases and contractor proposals and recommendations regarding the adequacy of contractor bids in terms of technical/financial and soundness/appropriateness. Update Performance Work Statements (PWS) as needed to conform to NAVFAC protocols
  • Monitor process compliance with command energy, environmental, safety, ATFP policies and make recommendations for correction
  • Participate in regular progress meetings with Clients, contractors, Navy Contracting Office officials and other interested parties regarding work in progress, completed, project status, discuss problems and provide recommendations to resolve issues
  • Attend Work Induction Board (WIB) meetings to present new work for scheduling and recommend appropriate routing and methods of accomplishment
  • Provide technical support in answering requests for information (RFI) from contractors
  • Review equipment inventories for accuracy and recommend additions and deletions to inventory lists.
  • Monitor ongoing maintenance work to check contractor progress and verify compliance with plans and specifications.
  • Make recommendations for the resolution of problems not involving changes to contract value, scope, terms, or duration; recommend solutions to the Government officials (Navy Contracting Office) for problems that may result in a change of contract value, terms or duration.
  • Provide support in finding, translating and interpreting host nation technical and safety standards as they apply to the performance of work
  • Monitor contractor’s maintenance of drawings as modifications and alterations to facilities are made. Make recommendations for correction.
  • Provide technical support in the areas of fire protection certification, elevator certifications, Boiler/UPV certifications by monitoring contractor compliance in the areas of Testing and Balancing (TABs), Duct Air Leakage Testing (DALTS), Digital Control Systems (DDC) for HVAC systems and making recommendations for correction.
  • Verify that the contractor provides a complete set of Operation and Maintenance Support Information (OMSI) Manuals and contactor provided user training for new equipment installed in the process of maintenance and/or equipment changes or upgrades. Make recommendations for correction.
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 

Qualifications To be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor of Science/Arts degree (or European/Southwest Asian equivalent) that sufficiently prepares the incumbent to manage maintenance operations and communicate effectively with a range of levels within the organization.
  • Extensive technical and practical knowledge and experience (at least 3 years) as a Customer Liaison (Facility Maintenance Operations), Maintenance Program Manager, Facility Equipment Inventory Manager, Planer/Estimator, Engineering Technician or Contracting Officer’ s Technical Representative Department of Navy or other Department of Defense Construction Projects
  • Demonstrated working knowledge of engineering and architecture principles, building construction, construction science or maintenance management.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform cost estimates and technical evaluation to compare contactor bids for technical soundness and make recommendations on reasonableness.
  • Experience demonstrating a sound understanding of facility construction and maintenance concepts, principles and practices applicable to multi-disciplined maintenance, repair and alteration projects
  • Demonstrated knowledge of maintenance practices and methods, and maintenance management skills
  • Demonstrated ability to monitor maintenance, repair and alteration projects to a successful and timely completion with respect to schedule and budget
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Single Platform Maximo (SPM) or other similar Computerized Maintenance Management systems (CMMS)
  • Ability to perform strenuous activity while working outdoors in extreme heat or cold, working in confined spaces, climbing and using fall protection equipment. Assigned Contractor personnel must present medical certificate of physical qualification showing that they are physically capable of performing the tasks outlined in the PWS
  • Demonstrated knowledge of safety and occupational health principles, practices, procedures, laws and regulations as they relate to maintenance performance requirements. (Outlined in the EM-385-1-1 and 29 CFR).
  • Proficient in using Microsoft Office suites
  • Strong communications skills in English both written and oral
  • Must successfully pass required security background investigation

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

Why Planate?

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally, and Professionally, Up and Down The Line.

We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

title: URGENT: Project Financial Analyst
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

This role will ensure the accuracy and completeness of project status and manage financial project systems and policies.

Salary per month: Php 35,000.00

 Key responsibilities:

  • Ensure accuracy of the Project Financial administration in PROCORE (Project Reporting Tool)
  • Prepare monthly financial and schedule reports with variance analysis for program management
  • Document the supporting information for all journal entries
  • Gather and analyze financial information for internal use
  • Prepare Project Variance Reports and provide analysis to assist Project Managers in decision making
  • Assist in developing and adjusting department procedures and systems enhancements
  • Provide monthly staff utilization reports of Divisions and groups using Procore tools; Extract all PMG timecard reports and upload to SharePoint in coordination with Payroll/Finance Teams.
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance
  • With 5 to 10 years in finance and/or accounting 
  • Experience in financial planning and analysis role
  • Dependability; Analytical Thinking; Attention to Detail; Coordination; Self-Motivated; Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Proficient with MS Office Applications, Advance MS Office Excel; Understanding and knowledge of accounting systems like Quickbooks
  • Strong communications skills in English both written and oral

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

title: Project Manager (Water)
description:
Planate Management Group is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, USA with a technical support center in the Philippines that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies.

The Project Manager will use technical engineering knowledge to recommend solutions for problems concerning nationwide system/utility designs, construction for water systems and other environmental hazard abatement projects at the Bureau of Indian Education Branch of Facility Management at Albuquerque, NM. This is contingent to the award of the contract.

Key responsibilities:

  • Monitor and track the progress of designated facility improvement projects
  • Provide technical assistance in identifying/verifying conditions, repair estimates and timetables
  • Support development of budget estimates and justifications
  • Develop plans and conceptual design solutions for renovations and improvements to facilities
  • Recommend potential solutions, renovations and improvements
  • Review proposed sites for a project, evaluates, and makes recommendations as to adequacy with regard to topography, subsurface conditions, utilities such as water, sewer, gas, electric power and heating systems, and development costs, and other pertinent factors
  • Assist with the development and review of construction documents to detail the project structure, mechanical and electrical systems
  • When necessary, performs onsite inspections and evaluations of physical facilities nationwide
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed

Qualifications to be successful in the role:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Engineering or Construction Management from an accredited college or university
  • Project Management Professional certification is preferred
  • Subject Matter Expert in water system engineering
  • Highly knowledgeable in MAXIMO asset management system, Information Management Systems and procurement process for architecture/engineering service contracts
  • Highly knowledgeable in engineering principles, concepts and practices
  • Extensive experience in project management for facility improvement is a must
  • Experienced in project management best practices, internal controls, project status reporting, management decision making and documentation
  • Knowledge of concepts, principles, and practices of facilities planning, architecture and engineering Excellent English writing and verbal communication skills to provide briefings, reports and position papers
  • Knowledge of Federal law, policy and regulations pertaining to facility management, architecture/engineering, and construction industry, and as well as industry codes and standards to monitor program compliance
  • Excellent English writing and verbal communication skills to provide briefings, reports and position papers
  • Must be US Citizen

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

Planate Management Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

The Team Leader will be responsible for water system improvements and related environmental hazard abatement for the Bureau of Indian Education Branch of Facility Management in Albuquerque, NM. This is contingent to the award of the contract.

Key responsibilities:

  • Lead, coordinate and provide day-to-day oversight the project team
  • Drive program goals to completion for nationwide design, construction or improvements
  • Implement appropriate oversight, management controls and procedures
  • Develop a strategic plan for water system improvements and improvement recommendations for facility management program
  • Ensure schedules, inspections, materials, methods and equipment are appropriate and timely
  • Ensure that projects comply with health and safety standards, construction codes, building codes, BIA Design Handbook Guidelines and other federal requirements
  • Review drawings, designs and specifications
  • Ensure that work order and project data are continuously updated in databases
  • Provide reports on work order status, schedule, progress tracking
  • Perform other responsibilities associated with this position as needed

title: Mechanical Engineer  (Washington DC)
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for providing a full scope project management duty in a variety of construction, repair, and maintenance contracts involving civil, architectural, electrical, and mechanical systems. Performs or directs surveys and investigations to establish baseline data necessary to initiate design. This is to support the VAMHCS project located in Washington DC.

Salary: 80k -115k per year with other benefits. 

Key responsibilities:                      

  • Responsible for contributing to all phases of capital project planning and delivery from concept, specification, design, analysis, construction, commissioning, and activation 
  • Responsible for professional reviews related to project management services required by the contract 
  • Perform other services during the construction phases that are not included in the contract vehicles associated with the project 
  • Review the contractor's submittals for technical compliance with contract requirements 
  • Advises on the coordination of disruptions to utility services as needed to keep construction progress on schedule and to minimize disruption to ongoing VA operations 
  • Assures completion of projects involving design and review applying seasoned professional technical knowledge and experience in the oversight of an interdisciplinary team engaged in carrying out projects 
  • Submit monthly reports indicating work completed, work in progress with estimated completion dates, work schedule, and outstanding work 
  • Utilize computer-assisted design software and equipment to support project designs and plans when necessary 
  • Provides decisive guidance and direction regarding the management of technical aspects of engineering related to building structures
  • Responsible for the overall management, in terms of technical quality, cost, and schedule
  • Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 

Qualifications To be successful in the role: 

  • Degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Minimum of 3 years of work experience in engineering and construction management of buildings and structures
  • Familiarity with scheduling cost estimating, and overall design integration is necessary
  • Ability to review and resolve engineering issues associated with construction and specification documents
  • Professional experience should also include strong technical writing skills
  • Must be proficient in CADD, and Microsoft Office and have to experience in document control and management.
  • The contractor shall provide verifiable evidence of experience and competence via resume and reference verification
  • Excellent English is written and verbal communication skills
  • Has a US driver’s license and must lawfully reside in the United States and be eligible for employment (Planate does not sponsor visas or work permits)

Visit our career site https://planate.com/careers/ to know more about our other openings.

COVID 19 PROTOCOL: Due to the nature of work, the successful candidate will be required to comply with all Federal guidelines regarding vaccination for all employees and contractors. Please refer to Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors for more information.

Why Planate?

Joining the Planate team opens you to an experience working for a Global company where you are among a team that is considered a premier trusted partner for planning, design, engineering, asset management, and professional service solutions anytime, anywhere.  We Take Care of Our Own; Personally, and Professionally, Up and Down The Line.

We’d love for you to be a part of our Global workforce, helping us serve as an effective and integrated partner to advance every client's mission!

  • Responsible for professional reviews related to project management services required by the contract 
  • Perform other services during the construction phases that are not included in the contract vehicles associated with the project 
  • Review the contractor's submittals for technical compliance with contract requirements 
  • Advises on the coordination of disruptions to utility services as needed to keep construction progress on schedule and to minimize disruption to ongoing VA operations 
  • Assures completion of projects involving design and review applying seasoned professional technical knowledge and experience in the oversight of an interdisciplinary team engaged in carrying out projects 
  • Submit monthly reports indicating work completed, work in progress with estimated completion dates, work schedule, and outstanding work 
  • Utilize computer-assisted design software and equipment to support project designs and plans when necessary 
  • Provides decisive guidance and direction regarding the management of technical aspects of engineering related to building structures
  • Responsible for the overall management, in terms of technical quality, cost, and schedule
  • Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 

Qualifications To be successful in the role: 

  • Degree in Civil Engineering
  • Minimum of 5 years of work experience in engineering and construction management of buildings and structures
  • Familiarity with scheduling cost estimating, and overall design integration is necessary
  • Ability to review and resolve engineering issues associated with construction and specification documents
  • Professional experience should also include strong technical writing skills
  • Must be proficient in CADD, and Microsoft Office and have to experience in document control and management.
  • The contractor shall provide verifiable evidence of experience and competence via resume and reference verification
  • Excellent English is written and verbal communication skills
  • Has a US driver’s license and must lawfully reside in the United States and be eligible for employment (Planate does not sponsor visas or work permits)

title: Sr. Mechanical Engineer (Washington DC)
description:
Planate Management Group (PMG) is a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) headquartered in Alexandria, Virginia, and Orlando, Florida USA with a technical support center in South East Asia and East Africa, that provides program management and facilities engineering services worldwide. Planate is a small business provider of planning, design, infrastructure management, technical consulting, engineering, and construction management services in support of the US Department of Defense (DOD) and its Service (Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps) missions, along with other US federal agencies, all over the world.

The Sr. Mechanical Engineer will be responsible for providing a full scope project management duty in a variety of construction, repair, and maintenance contracts involving civil, architectural, electrical, and mechanical systems. Performs or directs surveys and investigations to establish baseline data necessary to initiate design. This is to support the VAMHCS project located in Washington DC.

Salary: 100k -140k per year with other benefits. 

Key responsibilities:                      

  • Responsible for contributing to all phases of capital project planning and delivery from concept, specification, design, analysis, construction, commissioning, and activation 
  • Responsible for professional reviews related to project management services required by the contract 
  • Perform other services during the construction phases that are not included in the contract vehicles associated with the project 
  • Review the contractor's submittals for technical compliance with contract requirements 
  • Advises on the coordination of disruptions to utility services as needed to keep construction progress on schedule and to minimize disruption to ongoing VA operations 
  • Assures completion of projects involving design and review applying seasoned professional technical knowledge and experience in the oversight of an interdisciplinary team engaged in carrying out projects 
  • Submit monthly reports indicating work completed, work in progress with estimated completion dates, work schedule, and outstanding work 
  • Utilize computer-assisted design software and equipment to support project designs and plans when necessary 
  • Provides decisive guidance and direction regarding the management of technical aspects of engineering related to building structures
  • Responsible for the overall management, in terms of technical quality, cost, and schedule
  • Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate. 

Qualifications To be successful in the role: 

  • Degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Minimum of 5 years of work experience in engineering and construction management of buildings and structures
  • Familiarity with scheduling cost estimating, and overall design integration is necessary
  • Ability to review and resolve engineering issues associated with construction and specification documents
  • Professional experience should also include strong technical writing skills
  • Must be proficient in CADD, and Microsoft Office and have to experience in document control and management.
  • The contractor shall provide verifiable evidence of experience and competence via resume and reference verification
  • Excellent English is written and verbal communication skills
  • Has a US driver’s license and must lawfully reside in the United States and be eligible for employment (Planate does not sponsor visas or work permits)
